key.name: backlight-mode
key.description: If set to disabled, the Brightness slider will only control the Soft Brightness overlays. If set to blend, Soft Brightness will workntogether with your computer's back-light. The brightness slider and keyboard brightness hotkeys will control both the back-light and the Soft Brightness overlays at the same time. If set to chain, Soft Brightness will be used for the lowest part of the slider. Then over a given percentage of the slider, back-light control will be used.

key.name: monitors
key.description: The monitors whose brightness should be adjusted.

key.name: builtin-monitor
key.description: The name of the built-in monitor.

key.name: prevent-unredirect
key.description: If set to never, unredirection is never prevented. If set to when-correcting, unredirection will be prevented when the brightness is not at the maximum setting (and an alpha layer is lowering the brightness). If set to always, window unredirection will always be prevented when this extension is active, allowing tear-free display.

key.name: chain-mode-threshold
key.description: Sets the brightness value between _0_ and _1_ at which the switch is made between soft brightness and backlight control in chain mode.

key.name: clone-mouse
key.description: When enabled, the mouse cursor follows the brightness setting. When disabled, the mouse cursor always remains at full brightness. Controlling mouse cursor brightness can sometimes show the wrong cursor and introduce cursor lag. You may want to disable it if you encounter cursor issues. Note that if another Gnome Shell component clones the mouse (like the Zoom accessibility feature), the cursor will follow the screen brightness.
